children.text: There is a noticeable difference in the colour of the mortar used within the walls of the brickwork, with the colour changing from light to dark part-way up the wall, which detracts from the overall finish of this home.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 3.05 Blending and matching of Masonry – Repair Work states that
‘Mortar repairs should be carried out to match existing mortar as closely as practical’ .
These areas will have to be rectified so that the mortar joints are consistent throughout.
